author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
The package name seems a bit too broad/common for something specifically cosmological/neural network'y.
Would you be satisfied if I renamed it "AbstractCosmologicalEmulator" or stuff like that?

For my part that would be sufficient differentiation - but someone in the cosmological domain should probably weigh in.

Consider adding a plural “s” at the end.

[noblock]
You have already blocked the merging, right? I'll probably go for AbstractCosmologicalEmulators.jl

> @stemann I have modified the name of the package to AbstractCosmoEmulators.jl, as suggested.
> 
> Here is the [PR link](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/89088) Are you ok with that?

I think AbstractCosmoEmulators.jl is probably fine - even finer would probably have been AbstractCosmologicalEmulators.jl - there is something in the naming guidelines about avoiding abbreviations - not sure if it applies in this case.

@goerz might have a better say.

I'm just a random community member :-)
I have no problem with `AbstractCosmoEmulators`, personally
Just for the record: I’m just a random community member, too, although I keep tabs on new package registration and try to guide people through the process. I don’t have maintainer status, though.

Thx! So, given that both in this and [this other one](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/89018) there is at least one comment without the "noblock", they will not get merged, right?
I changed the name of the package in mean time to AbstractCosmologicalEmulators, so I will open a new PR.
Yes, you should be fine. Both of the old PRs will be closed automatically, eventually.

This pull request has been inactive for 30 days and will be automatically closed 7 days from now. If this pull request should not be closed, please either (1) fix the AutoMerge issues and re-trigger Registrator, which will automatically update the pull request, or (2) post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. [noblock]
This pull request has been inactive for more than 30 days and has automatically been closed. Feel free to register your package or version again once you fix the AutoMerge issues. [noblock]

body:
- Registering package: AbstractEmulator
- Repository: https://github.com/CosmologicalEmulators/AbstractEmulator.jl
- Created by: @marcobonici
- Version: v0.1.0
- Commit: 58346c1094fd1255ab6ca94f8dc2c4d01d900a32
- Git reference: HEAD
- Description: Repository containing the abstract interface to the emulators used in the CosmologicalEmulators.jl organization
title: New package: AbstractEmulator v0.1.0
